summary.title: Quantitative economist turned web developer
summary.intro: Looking for a role with a lot of responsibility, preferably working end-to-end with clients and their data (analyzing, planning, implementing and presenting), using JavaScript, CSS, Python/R.

experience.job_description: Contract full-stack web development for clients including Xfive.co and Laboratorium EE
job_bullets: Lead a technical redesign sprint to plan new features and improve code quality
Improved code review and developer onboarding processes
Created a framework for building HTML email templates in Node.js
Mentored two junior frontend developers in code review practices, testing and structuring code

experience.job_description: Selected for Outreachy internship program to work on Zulip, the open source group chat
job_bullets: Worked on user experience through discussions, improving developer and user docs
Conducted code reviews and worked in Python, Django, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

experience.job_title: Goldenberry, Business Analyst and Web Developer
experience.job_description: Transitioned from Business Analyst to Web Developer at GdziePoLek.pl, a startup launched and owned by Goldenberry
job_bullets: Full-stack development using C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and ASP.NET
Built new features, e.g. visualizations of price over time, maintained and improved legacy code base
Generated sites for each drug and city pair in the database, which improved GdziePoLek.pl's positioning in the search engine for specific search terms from top 10-15 result to top 1-3 result

experience.job_description: Worked as a data analyst, collaborated on healthcare initiatives
job_bullets: Created a framework for data analyses and visualizations using R, SQL and MS Excel
Main analyst during national negotiations concerning primary healthcare funding in December 2014)
Took part in a 6-week training for Regulatory Impact Assessments (RIAs) at the Department of Health (England)
Trained members of the Polish RIA healthcare team in writing and assessing RIAs, assessed over 200 RIAs
Lead the Evidence Informed Policy Network initiative (partnership with WHO)
Conduct conversational and live-coding admissions interviews; worked in numerous programming languages
Evaluating applicantsâ€™ programming ability and fit for program
Google Code-In - mentored high school students participating in the competition
Google Summer of Code - mentored two students in contributing to web app and React Native mobile client
Created a course for new programmers in Python
Helped teach young people (9-15) Python and Scratch (7-12)
